reference.shortdesc: A syntax diagram represents the syntax of a command, function call, or programming language statement.

section.title: Rendering expectations
section.p: Traditionally, the syntax diagram is formatted with "railroad tracks" that connect the units of the syntax together, but the presentation might vary depending on the output media.

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The syntaxdiagram element is specialized from fig. It is defined in the syntax-diagram domain module, which is a specialization of the programming domain module.

section.title: Attributes
section.p: The following attributes are available on this element: and .

example.title: Example
example.p: The following code sample shows how a syntaxdiagramcan be used to illustrate the syntax of a basic file-copy command. The initial COPYF command is followed by the input directory and file name. The input is followed by a choice of either an output directory (and optional file name) or a file name.
